definition: to sit cross-legged/to sit in the lotus position

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: At night before he went to bed he practiced sitting with his legs crossed, and then he stretched his back by curling himself into a ball.
sentences.chinese: 晚上上牀之前，他練習盤腿坐，然後把背彎成一個球。

sentences.english: I unconsciously put my pace slightly and sit cross-legged on her opposite side of the reef.
sentences.chinese: 我不自覺地把腳步放輕，盤腿坐到她對面的礁石上。

sentences.english: Sit on an upright chair or cross-legged on a cushion on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 做在一個直背椅或盤腿坐在地板軟墊上。

sentences.english: They sat on the bed cross-legged and looked at each other.
sentences.chinese: 他們盤腿坐在牀上看着對方。

sentences.english: Red hunkers down and joins him. Nothing is said for the longest time.
sentences.chinese: 瑞德盤腿坐到他旁邊，兩個人很長時間也沒有說話。

sentences.english: I could never sit Indian-style the way other kids did.
sentences.chinese: 我從來不能象其他孩子那樣挺直腰板盤腿而坐。

sentences.english: I sat cross legged in the sand and contemplated my life.
sentences.chinese: 我盤腿坐在沙上，沉思自己的人生。

sentences.english: Lo and behold, the boy sat in the cross-legged position, suspended in mid-air, without falling.
sentences.chinese: 瞧啊，男孩盤腿懸在半空中，沒有掉下來。

sentences.english: A few nights later when her daddy came in, Jenny was sitting on her bed with her legs crossed 13)Indian-style.
sentences.chinese: 過了幾夜，爸爸走進詹妮的房間，她正盤腿坐在牀上。

sentences.english: We sat cross-legged on the matting.
sentences.chinese: 我們在塌塌米上盤腿而坐。

sentences.english: He was sitting cross-legged, his back was straight and yet he seemed to be so relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 這時他背脊挺直盤腿坐着，可是又似乎很輕鬆。

sentences.english: They played on deck, sitting cross-legged behind the cabin.
sentences.chinese: 他們在甲板上玩起來，在艙後盤腿而坐。

sentences.english: A few nights later when her daddy came in, Jenny was sitting on her bed with her legs crossed Indian-style.
sentences.chinese: 過了幾夜，爸爸走進詹妮的房間，她正盤腿坐在牀上。

definition: to relax with one's eyes closed
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke
summer sleeping mat (e.g. of woven split bamboo)/CL:張|张[zhang1],領|领[ling3]
lit. not eating the food of common mortals/fig. placing oneself above the common populace
pinyin: bu4 shi2 ren2 jian1 yan1 huo3
